009package imagingbook.common.filter.linear;
010
011import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
012
013/**
014 * This class represents a 2D filter kernel.
015 * 
016 * @author WB
017 * @version 2020/12/29
018 */
019public class Kernel2D {
020        
021        private final float[][] H;      // H[y][x] !!
022        private final int xc, yc;
023        private final int width, height;
024        
025        /**
026         * Convenience constructor.
027         * Assumes that the kernel's hot spot is at its center,
028         * does normalization by default.
029         * 
030         * @param H the 2D kernel array
031         */
032        public Kernel2D(float[][] H) {
033                this(H, (H[0].length - 1) / 2, (H.length - 1) / 2, true);
034        }
035        
036        /**
037         * Full constructor.
038         * 
039         * @param H the 2D kernel array
040         * @param xc the x-coordinate of the kernel's hot spot, default is (width-1)/2
041         * @param yc the y-coordinate of the kernel's hot spot, default is (height-1)/2
042         * @param normalize if true the kernel is normalized (to sum = 1)
043         */
044        public Kernel2D(float[][] H, int xc, int yc, boolean normalize) {
045                this.H = (normalize) ? normalize(H) : Matrix.duplicate(H);
046                this.width = H[0].length;
047                this.height = H.length;
048                this.xc = xc;
049                this.yc = yc;
050                validate();
051        }
052        
053        /**
054         * Creates the effective 2D kernel from two 1D kernels.
055         * 
056         * @param Hx the 1D kernel for the x-direction
057         * @param Hy the 1D kernel for the y-direction
058         * @param normalize if true the kernel is normalized (to sum = 1)
059         */
060        public Kernel2D(Kernel1D Hx, Kernel1D Hy, boolean normalize) {
061                this(getEffectiveKernel(Hx, Hy), Hx.getXc(), Hy.getXc(), normalize);
062        }
063        
064        /**
065         * Calculates the effective 2D kernel array from two 1D kernels
066         * assumed to be applied in x- and y-direction, respectively.
067         * The result is not normalized.
068         * Use the constructor {@link #Kernel2D(Kernel1D, Kernel1D, boolean)}
069         * to create the equivalent (optionally normalized) 2D kernel.
070         * Note that the kernel coordinates are {@code H[y][x]}.
071         * 
072         * @param Hx the 1D kernel for the x-direction
073         * @param Hy the 1D kernel for the y-direction
074         * @return the effective 2D kernel matrix
075         */
076        public static float[][] getEffectiveKernel(Kernel1D Hx, Kernel1D Hy) {
077                float[] kernelX = Hx.getH();
078                float[] kernelY = Hy.getH();
079                
080                float[][] kernel = new float[kernelX.length][kernelY.length];
081                for (int y = 0; y < kernelY.length; y++) {
082                        for (int x = 0; x < kernelX.length; x++) {
083                                kernel[y][x] = kernelX[x] * kernelY[y];
084                        }
085                }
086                return kernel;
087        }
088        
089        private void validate() {
090                if (!Matrix.isRectangular(H))
091                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("non-rectangular filter kernel");
092                // TODO: should we check if xc/yc is inside the kernel? does it matter?
093        }
094        
095        /**
096         * Returns the kernel's 2D array.
097         * Note that the kernel coordinates are {@code H[y][x]}.
098         * @return the kernel's 2D array
099         */
100        public float[][] getH() {
101                return H;
102        }
103        
104        /**
105         * Returns the width of this kernel.
106         * @return the kernel's width
107         */
108        public int getWidth() {
109                return width;
110        }
111        
112        /**
113         * Returns the height of this kernel.
114         * @return the kernel's height
115         */
116        public int getHeight() {
117                return height;
118        }
119        
120        /**
121         * Returns the horizontal center coordinate of this kernel.
122         * @return the kernel's x-center coordinate
123         */
124        public int getXc() {
125                return xc;
126        }
127        
128        /**
129         * Returns the vertical center coordinate of this kernel.
130         * @return the kernel's y-center coordinate
131         */
132        public int getYc() {
133                return yc;
134        }
135        
136        // ----------------------------------------------------------
137        
138        /**
139         * Normalizes the specified array such that its sum becomes 1.
140         * Throws an exception if the array's sum is zero.
141         * The original array is not modified.
142         * 
143         * @param A a 2D array
144         * @return the normalized array
145         */
146        public static float[][] normalize(float[][] A) throws ArithmeticException {
147                float s = (float) (1.0 / Matrix.sum(A));
148                if (!Double.isFinite(s))
149                        throw new ArithmeticException("zero kernel sum, cannot normalize");
150                return Matrix.multiply(s, A);
151        }
152
153}
